item.title: 中国市场黄金周后重新开市 交易员关注更多刺激措施
三星业绩令人失望，人工智能芯片与竞争对手差距依然存在
item.description: 三星电子公司公布的利润和收入低于市场预期，加剧了其关键芯片部门前景的不确定性。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. posted profit and revenue that fell short of market expectations, stoking uncertainty about the outlook of its pivotal chip division.】

item.title: 澳大利亚本季暖海域将出现更多强力气旋
item.description: 据澳大利亚气象机构称，本季度澳大利亚可能会遭遇数量超过平均水平的强热带气旋，这些气旋有可能破坏农作物并淹没采矿作业。【原文：Australia is likely to see an above average number of severe tropical cyclones this season, according to the nation’s weather agency, which have the potential to damage crops and flood mining operations.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好科技巨头拖累股市走低。美国债券溃败加深。中国券商为疯狂的周二做好准备。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Tech megacaps drag stocks lower. US bond rout deepens. Brokerages in China gear up for a frantic Tuesday. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 银行利用香港贴现窗口获取 2019 年以来最多资金
item.description: 香港银行向当局借入了近五年来最大一笔短期现金，此举表明对流动资金的需求突然增加。【原文：Hong Kong banks borrowed the largest amount of short-term cash in almost five years from authorities, a move pointing to a sudden demand for liquidity.】

item.title: 中国公开赛前中东紧张局势缓和，石油上涨
item.description: 由于中东紧张局势加剧，投资者为中国市场在一周假期后重新开市做准备，石油连续第六个交易日上涨。【原文：Oil advanced for a sixth straight session on mounting tensions in the Middle East, as investors prepared for the reopening of Chinese markets after a week-long holiday.】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特抛售美国银行股票的狂潮超过 100 亿美元
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的企业集团在长达数月的美国银行（Bank of America Corp.【原文：Warren Buffett’s conglomerate has added another zero to its haul from a months-long selling spree of Bank of America Corp. stock.】

item.title: 拥有 15 万亿美元的投资者向矿商发出新信号
item.description: 如果采矿业要满足绿色转型对矿产和金属日益增长的需求，投资者就需要对采矿业采取新的方法。【原文：Investors need to adopt a new approach to the mining sector if that industry is to meet the growing demand for minerals and metals needed for the green transition.】

item.title: 经济学家称中国可能以创纪录的赤字结束刺激政策
item.description: 据一位顶级经济学家称，中国可以通过将财政赤字率提高到历史最高水平来加大刺激力度，他说此举将反映出政府对今年 5%左右增长目标的承诺。【原文：China has the option of boosting stimulus by raising its fiscal deficit ratio to the highest ever, according to a top economist, a move he said would reflect the government’s commitment to this year’s growth target of around 5%.】

item.title: IPhone 制造商鸿海称电动汽车业务需要数年才能增长
item.description: 鸿海精密工业股份有限公司（Hon Hai Precision Industry Co., Ltd.）表示，由于全球电动汽车销售放缓，该公司将需要数年时间来建立其新生的汽车业务部门，而该公司生产和销售采用英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）芯片的人工智能服务器的业务一直在蓬勃发展和快速增长。【原文：Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. said that it will take years to build up its nascent automotive arm as electric vehicle sales slow globally, while its business of making and selling AI servers with Nvidia Corp. chips has been booming and growing fast.】

item.title: 中国重开前亚洲交易员态度谨慎：市场综述
item.description: 在美国股市下跌之后，亚洲股市开盘谨慎，交易员们准备迎接中国市场在长达一周的假期后重新开市。【原文：Asian stocks were set for a cautious start after losses in the US, with traders preparing for Chinese markets to reopen following a week-long holiday.】

item.title: 丹-莫里略谈多策略对冲基金背后的数学原理
item.description: 多策略对冲基金在华尔街仍然风靡一时，但 pod shop 的实际含义是什么？在本期节目中，我们采访了 Freestone Grove Partners 的联合创始人 Dan Morillo，他曾是 Citadel（最成功的多策略对冲基金之一）的合伙人兼股票量化研究主管。【原文：Multi-strategy hedge funds are still all the rage on Wall Street, but what does it actually mean to be a pod shop and how are they being set up? On this episode, we speak with Dan Morillo, co-founder of Freestone Grove Partners and formerly a partner and head of equity quantitative research at Citadel (one of the most successful multi-strats out there.) While lots of people tend to talk about multi-strategy hedge funds as one big blob, he argues that there are important differences in their busi】

item.title: 稳健的盈利将刺激日本股市保持 2024 年涨势的希望
item.description: 在动荡的一年中，日本股市从全球表现最佳的市场之一沦为全球经济衰退的中心，投资者指望稳健的盈利能帮助日本股市在最后阶段保持涨势。【原文：Investors are counting on solid earnings to help Japanese shares hold their gains in the final stretch of a volatile year that saw the market go from one of the world’s top performers to the epicenter of a global meltdown.】

item.title: 刺激经济后，投资中国的巨大分歧在加深
item.description: 中国政府的经济刺激政策引发了对冲基金和个人投资者的疯狂买股。但大型资产配置机构和跨国公司对急于重返亚洲最大经济体持谨慎态度。【原文：Beijing’s pivot toward economic stimulus has sparked fevered stock buying from hedge funds and individual investors. But big asset allocators and multinational companies are wary of rushing back into Asia’s largest economy.】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔要求企业在电力危机中减少用电量
item.description: 在几十年来最严重的干旱中，厄瓜多尔命令一些工业企业削减日常用电量，这引起了主要商业协会和大陆股份公司（Continental AG）等公司的反弹。【原文：Ecuador ordered some industrial firms to slash their daily electricity usage amid its worst drought in decades, drawing backlash from major business associations and companies like Continental AG.】

item.title: 看涨中国追踪 ETF 在假期结束前触及高点
item.description: 周一，在美国交易的与中国挂钩的交易所交易基金（ETF）的短期期权成本升至新高，原因是在岸市场在长达一周的假期后于周二重新开市之前，股价延续涨势。【原文：The cost for short-term options on China-linked ETFs traded in the US rose to fresh highs Monday as shares extended a rally ahead of onshore markets reopening Tuesday after a week-long holiday.】

item.title: 中国 130 个城市提供优惠，假日期间房屋销售大幅增长
item.description: 据报道，在中国为期一周的长假期间，房地产销售火爆，购房者兴趣浓厚，由此可见，中国振兴房地产市场的最新措施已产生立竿见影的效果。但反弹能否持续则是另一回事。【原文：China’s latest steps to revive the housing market have had an immediate impact, judging from reports of brisk sales and buyer interest during the nation’s week-long holiday. Whether the rebound will be sustained is another matter.】

item.title: ESPN 博彩公司所有者认为在线投注亏损缩小，赌场面临挑战
item.description: 经营 ESPN Bet 在线博彩业务的宾夕法尼亚娱乐公司（Penn Entertainment Inc.【原文：Penn Entertainment Inc., which operates the ESPN Bet online gambling business, said the third-quarter loss from its interactive casino was narrower than previously forecast.】

item.title: 苹果公司全球采购主管丹-罗斯克斯将退休
item.description: 苹果公司全球供应链采购主管丹-罗斯克斯（Dan Rosckes）在这家 iPhone 制造商任职 24 年后即将退休，这将为这个关键职位带来新的管理层。【原文：Apple Inc.’s global supply chain procurement chief, Dan Rosckes, is retiring after 24 years at the iPhone maker, bringing fresh management to a critical position.】

item.title: 约翰-保尔森与波多黎各前合伙人加法尔的欺诈诉讼达成和解
item.description: 约翰-保尔森在波多黎各的前商业伙伴同意撤销对这位亿万富翁的欺诈诉讼，作为秘密和解的一部分。【原文：John Paulson’s former Puerto Rico business partner agreed to drop a fraud lawsuit against the billionaire as part of a confidential settlement.】

item.title: FTX 明确将向客户退款，因为公司要求分得 10 亿美元的一杯羹
item.description: 加密货币公司 FTX 赢得了法院的批准，将向客户全额偿还其数字资产，这些客户的数字资产在近两年前该平台发生内讧时被锁定在该平台上，这一不寻常的结果可能会让山姆-班克曼-弗里德（Sam Bankman-Fried）的欺诈交易所股东从被扣押的 10 亿美元资产中分得一杯羹。【原文：Cryptocurrency firm FTX won court approval to fully repay customers whose digital assets were locked on the platform when it imploded nearly two years ago, an unusual result that could net shareholders in Sam Bankman-Fried’s fraud-tainted exchange a slice of $1 billion in seized assets.】

item.title: 前加拿大央行官员预计 10 月将大幅降息
item.description: 加拿大银行管理机构的一位前成员表示，官员们应在本月晚些时候将借贷成本降低半个百分点。【原文：An ex-member of the Bank of Canada’s governing body said officials should cut borrowing costs by half a percentage point later this month.】

item.title: 循环信贷减少导致美国消费者借贷增长放缓
item.description: 受信用卡余额自 2021 年 3 月以来最大降幅的制约，8 月份美国消费者借贷增长速度低于上月。【原文：US consumer borrowing increased in August at a slower pace than a month earlier, restrained by the largest drop in credit-card balances since March 2021.】

item.title: 意大利央行发出对政府增长目标的担忧信号
item.description: 意大利银行对该国的经济增长表示担忧，称今年的经济扩张可能会低于此前的预期，从而使政府更难实现其目标。【原文：The Bank of Italy signaled concern about the country’s growth, saying the economy will likely expand less than previously expected this year, making it more difficult for the government to reach its targets.】

item.title: 法官裁定：Google Play 必须允许竞争对手开设 Android 应用商店
item.description: 一名法官裁定，Alphabet 公司必须取消阻止开发者建立与其 Google Play 商店竞争的竞争对手市场的限制，从而颠覆这家搜索巨头在利润丰厚的安卓应用程序市场的主导地位。【原文：Alphabet Inc. must lift restrictions that prevent developers from setting up rival marketplaces that compete with its Google Play Store, a judge ruled, upending the search giant’s dominance in the lucrative Android app market.】

item.title: 欧盟借贷部门建议通过 IPO 投资促进市场联盟
item.description: 作为降低资本壁垒和提高竞争力努力的一部分，欧盟的贷款部门正在制定促进公司在集团内上市的计划。【原文：The European Union’s lending arm is working on plans to facilitate company listings across the bloc as part of efforts to bring down barriers to capital and boost competitiveness.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯 PIF 将持有塞尔福里奇百货公司 40% 的股份
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯公共投资基金在买下现已破产的 Signa 集团的股份后，将成为连锁百货公司塞尔福里奇百货公司的少数合伙人。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund is set to become a minority partner in department store chain Selfridges after buying out the position of the now-insolvent Signa Group.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会提起的亚马逊反垄断案将在裁决后继续审理
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）必须面对美国联邦贸易委员会（US Federal Trade Commission）就其在线市场提起的反垄断诉讼，但一名联邦法官驳回了该机构与州消费者保护法相关的部分诉求。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. must face an antitrust suit filed by the US Federal Trade Commission over its online marketplace, but a federal judge dismissed some of the agency’s claims tied to state consumer protection laws.】

item.title: 美联储降息押注被修正，短期债券大跌
item.description: 在一份井喷式的就业报告导致投资者重新调整美联储再次大幅降息的可能性之后，期限最短的市政债券遭到抛售。【原文：The shortest-dated municipal bonds sold off after a blowout jobs report caused investors to recalibrate the odds of another big interest-rate cut from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: CNRL 的 65 亿美元雪佛龙交易扩大了油砂收购热潮
item.description: 加拿大自然资源有限公司（Canadian Natural Resources Ltd.）斥资 65 亿美元从雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）手中收购了阿尔伯塔省（Alberta）的大量油砂矿藏，这标志着该公司成为加拿大最大的石油生产商，并几乎完全由当地控制的一系列交易中的最新一笔。【原文：Canadian Natural Resources Ltd.’s $6.5 billion acquisition from Chevron Corp. marks the latest in a string of deals that has helped make it the country’s largest oil producer and brought Alberta’s massive oil sands deposits almost entirely under local control.】
